feature1.explanation: Both texts use standard punctuation marks such as periods, commas, and apostrophes. Both texts also use dashes and quotation marks.

feature2.explanation: Both texts exhibit similar word choice and grammatical structures. They use similar vocabulary and sentence structures.

feature3.explanation: Both texts have medium sentence complexity and coherence. The sentence lengths and structures are comparable.

feature4.explanation: Both texts have a similar tone and mood, focusing on presenting arguments. The narrative style is consistent across the texts.

feature5.explanation: There are no spelling or typographical errors in either of the texts.

overall.explanation: Considering the commonalities in punctuation, lexical and grammatical features, sentence structure, text and discourse features, as well as the absence of spelling errors, there is a high likelihood that these texts were written by the same author.
